text: The Union Dutchwomen represented Union College in ECAC women's ice hockey during the 2015–16 NCAA Division I women's ice hockey season. == Recruiting == {|class="wikitable" width="80%" |- style="" | Player || Position ||Nationality || Notes |- align="center" bgcolor=" " | Melissa Black || Goaltender || || Member of Aurora Jr. Panthers |- align="center" bgcolor="#ccffcc" | Arianna Kosakowski || Defense || || Played for Assabet Valley |- align="center" bgcolor=" " | Kelli Mackey || Forward/Defense || || Played with the Team Pittsburgh U19 |- align="center" bgcolor="#ccffcc" | Leah Patrick || Goaltender || || Attended Hill-Murray HS |- align="center" bgcolor=" " | Jacyn Reeves || Forward/Defense || || Played on Team Wisconsin with Sloan Sullivan |- align="center" bgcolor="#ccffcc" | Sloan Sullivan || Defense || || Blueliner with Team Wisconsin |- align="center" bgcolor=" " |} == 2015–16 Dutchwomen == ==2015-16 Schedule== Despite a largely frustrating season, the Dutchwomen remained competitive in many of their ECAC games, proving to be tough opposition to teams such as Colgate, Cornell and Yale, and never surrendered more than 4 goals to a team that was not nationally ranked. |- !colspan=12 style=""| Regular Season ==References== Union Category:Union Dutchwomen ice hockey seasons
title: 2015–16 Union Dutchwomen's ice hockey season
